intro: Tounatea acuminata, commonly known as the sharp-pointed tounatea, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its elongated, pointed leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, preferring moist and nutrient-rich soils. Tounatea acuminata is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
